title: A GENUINE Draft
body_text:
CXX-SIX Results:
Dodgeball Draft #3
A never-ending build-up? Silly "storylines"? An event so extraordinarily star-studded and almost too intense to handle needs neither.
And "The Writer" agrees. The first fourteen picks
(as seen on the right)
tell the gripping story all by its lonesome. Throw in some brave reinforcements like "PowerRanger" Matt Brown, new sensation Dan Neal, and legendary figures Pierce, Stopa, and Chris Adams, and you've got an insane brawl for it all!
Flash Results by Game
Team ONE: 3, 4, 6, 11
Team TWO: 1, 2, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10
Each of the seemingly indestructible armies traded victories throughout this frigid February massacre. By the 7th, however, one could tell Team TWO had made the turn and their adversaries wound up in deep trouble. Team ONE, those undying members "you", never fully rebounded back from four consecutive defeats.
Team TWO wins it 6 to 4. Hats off to each and every competitor for a phenomenal showing.
Moments & Stars
: Ryan Letsche the "Last Man Standing" in about half of the games as well as the mid-court, game-halting wedgie given to his cousin Bobby Vetrano; Team TWO's "scream-rush" to start Game 8; Juan Londono's crushing nutshot on Kevin Adams; Travis Mills's ballet-dodges; Chris Adams pelted in the face by Kevin Megill
Double Eliminations
: Lenny Herrera/Dan Neal, Mike Edwards/Mike "Sputz" Krott, Kevin Adams/Adam Kaufman, Diana DiBuccio/Justin Pierce, Lauren Stopa/John Tronolone
RECORDS
Attendance:
24
(21 men, 3 women)
One
New Player: Dan Neal.
Notable Returns: Adam Kaufman (previous DB 38), Ben Cotta (previous DB 75).
- The idea behind the CXX-SIX design was taken from the
Mortal Kombat Mythologies
video game. The poster was also the first in the two-plus years history to read "EastCoastDodgeball".
- This was already the third time this season an attendance reached 24.
- DODGEBALL CXX-SIX featured just the third
Dodgeball Draft
. Team TWO won this war 6 to 4.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
body_html:
CXX-SIX Results: Dodgeball Draft #3
A never-ending build-up? Silly "storylines"? An event so extraordinarily star-studded and almost too intense to handle needs neither.

And "The Writer" agrees. The first fourteen picks (as seen on the right) tell the gripping story all by its lonesome. Throw in some brave reinforcements like "PowerRanger" Matt Brown, new sensation Dan Neal, and legendary figures Pierce, Stopa, and Chris Adams, and you've got an insane brawl for it all!

Flash Results by Game
Team ONE: 3, 4, 6, 11
Team TWO: 1, 2, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10

Each of the seemingly indestructible armies traded victories throughout this frigid February massacre. By the 7th, however, one could tell Team TWO had made the turn and their adversaries wound up in deep trouble. Team ONE, those undying members "you", never fully rebounded back from four consecutive defeats.

Team TWO wins it 6 to 4. Hats off to each and every competitor for a phenomenal showing.

Moments & Stars: Ryan Letsche the "Last Man Standing" in about half of the games as well as the mid-court, game-halting wedgie given to his cousin Bobby Vetrano; Team TWO's "scream-rush" to start Game 8; Juan Londono's crushing nutshot on Kevin Adams; Travis Mills's ballet-dodges; Chris Adams pelted in the face by Kevin Megill

Double Eliminations: Lenny Herrera/Dan Neal, Mike Edwards/Mike "Sputz" Krott, Kevin Adams/Adam Kaufman, Diana DiBuccio/Justin Pierce, Lauren Stopa/John Tronolone

RECORDS
Attendance: 24 (21 men, 3 women)
One New Player: Dan Neal.
Notable Returns: Adam Kaufman (previous DB 38), Ben Cotta (previous DB 75).

- The idea behind the CXX-SIX design was taken from the Mortal Kombat Mythologies video game. The poster was also the first in the two-plus years history to read "EastCoastDodgeball".
- This was already the third time this season an attendance reached 24.
- DODGEBALL CXX-SIX featured just the third Dodgeball Draft. Team TWO won this war 6 to 4.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
